intro: Spermacoce homblei, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late summer to early autumn. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Spermacoce homblei is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
